data.text: @Darold191 @ImJeffRussell1 If I were you I'd get the vaccine asap.

@Darold191 @gscucci I agree with Gary, a lot would depend on your health.  

If I were in the same situation I would probably go ahead and get the vaccine now and then take your wife the moment she has the opportunity.

@Darold191 @ImJeffRussell1 How's your health? I'm 65 and cancer survivor. Wifey is 59 and healthy. I'll get mine at the end of month. She'll get hers ASAP when she can. We don't want to get the same time in case of a reaction. It works for us.
@gscucci @ImJeffRussell1 I’m old enough for the vaccine now but I’ll wait until my wife (16 years younger than me) can get it too. Thoughts?
@ImJeffRussell1 Me to. It is a shame we all have to jump through hoops just to try to stay alive.
@williamfkane2 Sorry you had to do all that but happy that you were able to get your first dose.
@ImJeffRussell1 I had to drive an hour yesterday morning for an 8:30 appointment and was told they pushed them back till3pm. So I had to make 2 trips but finally got it. Amen.
@ImJeffRussell1 I am scheduled for Thursday morning and second dose is 28 days after that. Glad you got yours.

@williamfkane2 That sucks....  I went through a lot to get mine and had to travel 2hrs away and stay in a hotel because of snow and didn't want to miss the appointment.  They made the second one right there and that's what others should do.
@ImJeffRussell1 I got mine yesterday but they wouldn't schedule the second one. Here in Delaware you have to keep signing up for lists over and over again.
@ImJeffRussell1 Good for you. Connecticut has just started 65 and older. Mine is scheduled for the 27th.
@ImJeffRussell1 I hope you do well with it. I am set up for Friday. 💉
